content.title: Scheme for Establishment of Hi-Tech and Mini Dairy Units under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana
content.beneficiary: Residents of Haryana aged 18 to 60 years
content.details: The scheme 'Scheme for Establishment of Hi-Tech and Mini Dairy Units under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana (MMAPUY)' is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, a resident of Haryana who is between 18 and 60 years of age can avail a 25% subsidy on the cost of two milch animals. The subsidy can be availed as a loan for the purchase of these milch animals by the beneficiary for the establishment of dairy units with two milch animals.
benefits: 25% subsidy on the cost of milch animals which has been availed as a loan for the purchase of these milch animals by the beneficiary for the establishment of dairy units of 2 milch animals

Insurance assistance will be provided as per the available departmental scheme if operational during the year; otherwise, the beneficiaries will have to arrange for insurance of animals and shall pay the insurance premium.
eligibility: The applicant should be of 18 to 60 years of age and a resident of Haryana.
There would be no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.
The applicant can apply for a dairy unit of 2 Milch animals only.
The applicant should have space/shed for keeping milch animals.
The applicant would have to submit a Self-Declaration for being unemployed and for undertaking to abide by other conditions as required under the Scheme.
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme, as the Scheme is individual beneficiary-oriented.
content.application_process: Offline and Online - via CSCs. To avail the benefits of the scheme, applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district and collect the application form. Fill out the application form and attach all the relevant documents. Submit the completely filled application form and attached documents to the concerned official in the office. The Deputy Director of the concerned district will examine the applications on a first-come, first-served basis and process them accordingly.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Residents of Haryana aged 18 to 60 years who are unemployed and have space for keeping milch animals are eligible.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A 25% subsidy on the cost of two milch animals, availed as a loan, is provided for establishing dairy units.

faqs.question: Is there any assistance for insurance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, insurance assistance is provided as per the available departmental scheme. If not operational, beneficiaries must arrange and pay for the insurance.

faqs.question: What are the age criteria for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be between 18 and 60 years of age.

faqs.question: Can educational qualifications or training affect eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.

faqs.question: How many milch animals can be purchased under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme allows for the purchase of two milch animals.

faqs.question: Can groups, firms, or organizations apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, groups, firms, or organizations cannot apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of space is required for keeping the milch animals?
faqs.answer: Applicants should have adequate space or a shed for keeping the milch animals.

faqs.question: Is there any self-declaration required?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must submit a self-declaration confirming their unemployment status and agreement to abide by the scheme’s conditions.

faqs.question: How can eligible applicants apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail the benefits of the scheme, applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district and collect the application form.
